snippet: Dainty bottles from Frappuccino drinks were filled with gasoline and used in attacks Sunday near the Queens-Nassau border.
abstract: Investigators believe that in a rash of firebombings Sunday near the Queens-Nassau border, a small glass bottle used by Starbucks to sell its popular Frappuccino drinks was the incendiary component of choice in most of the attacks.
lead_paragraph: Dainty bottles from Frappuccino drinks were filled with gasoline and used in attacks Sunday near the Queens-Nassau border.

headline.seo: Starbucks Frappuccino Bottles as Firebomber’s Tool
headline.main: Small and Light, Starbucks Bottles as Canisters for Bombs
headline.print_headline: Small and Light, Starbucks Bottles as Canisters for Bombs
